seo.metaTitle: NWA Daily - A daily newsletter about all things Northwest Arkansas
seo.metaDescription: NWA Daily is a daily email newsletter that keeps readers up to date on the latest Northwest Arkansas news or NWA news in events, restaurants, business,  the community, politics, art, entertainment, culture, and sports in Northwest Arkansas including news about Bentonville, Rogers, Springdale, and Fayetteville

posts.title: Fayetteville Public Library Provides Rooms For Personal Study and Private Events
posts.content:
Whether you‚Äôre an event planner in need of a venue or a remote worker looking for a change of scenery, Fayetteville Public Library offers affordable event spaces and free study rooms.

Places to Work: Several meeting rooms and over 20 study rooms are available to reserve for up to 4 hours at a time ‚Äî perfect for a team meeting, tutoring sessions, or just a quiet space to work or study. Room reservations are free for library cardholders.

Places to Play: Event venues for medium to large-scale events are available at reasonable rates, including the Event Center (with a 1,000-person standing room capacity), multiple board rooms, a dance studio, a 16-station kitchen, and a beautiful outdoor courtyard space.

Visit faylib.org/reservations to book a room or faylib.org/rentals for more information about available event spaces.

Looking for a great way to stay cool and have fun this summer? Wilson Park Pool in Fayetteville is the perfect place to make a splash, offering recreational swimming, instructional swim lessons, fitness opportunities, family swim times, and more. Here's everything you need to know about the pool's hours, admission prices, and special events for Summer 2023.

Summer 2023 Hours

Open Swim:

  • Monday-Friday: 1 - 4:30 p.m.
  • Saturday-Sunday: 1 - 6 p.m.

Family Swim:

  • Monday, Wednesday, Friday: 6 - 8 p.m.

Adult Lap Swim:

  • Monday-Friday: 11 a.m. - 1 p.m.
  • Saturday: Noon - 1 p.m.

Holiday Hours:

  • Open Swim: 1 - 6 p.m.
  • Adult Lap Swim: Noon- 1 p.m.

Check for any interruptions to normal hours here.

Admission Prices and Passes

  • Daily Youth (15 years and under): $3
  • Daily Adult: $4
  • Family Swim: $8 per family (only available during designated family swim times)
  • Punch Pass (10 Visits): $35
  • Season Adult: $75
  • Season Family: $135* (family of 5) $10.00 fee per each additional family member added

Children under the age of seven must be accompanied by a person sixteen years of age or older. Children under the age of one are free. Purchase your pool pass online.

About Wilson Park Pool

Tucked into one of Fayetteville's most popular parks, the Wilson Park Pool is surrounded by shade trees and beautiful landscaping, providing a pleasant atmosphere for your swimming experience. Fayetteville's only municipal pool is operated by the Parks, Natural Resources and Cultural Affairs Department, offering concessions for your convenience.

For more information, call the pool house during the season at 479-442-2641 or the Parks, Natural Resources and Cultural Affairs Department office during the off-season at 479-444-3474.

Reservations and Rental Options

Wilson Park Pool offers various rental options for private parties and groups, including full pool rental, half pool rental, and public swim party pods. Rental prices start at $100, and reservations can be made online starting May 1st.

Day Care, Group, and Camp Reservations are also available during normal business hours, with a five-day advance notice required.

Dive-In Movies

Enjoy a movie under the stars with the 2023 Dive-In Movies at Wilson Park Pool. Films begin at dusk (approximately 8:45 p.m.), with tickets priced at $1 in advance and $2 at the gate. Kids 3 and under are free. Capacity is limited to 420, so grab your tickets early!

Wrap-Up

Make your summer memorable with a visit to Wilson Park Pool in Fayetteville. With a variety of swim hours, admission options, and special events, there's something for everyone to enjoy. So, gather your family and friends, pack your swimsuits, and dive into a summer of fun! Check out our Splash Pad Guide if you're looking for other watering holes to cool off in in the summer in NWA!

The Walton Arts Center and Walmart AMP envision a future where they are nationally renowned for their innovative, inclusive approach to providing first-class arts experiences. Positioned at the heart of Northwest Arkansas' cultural and entertainment scene, these institutions strive for relevance, inclusivity, sustainability, and excellence in order to create a vibrant community where access to great art is fundamental.

NWA Daily

Diverse Programming for All Audiences

Both the Walton Arts Center and Walmart AMP offer a diverse array of arts experiences, appealing to various audiences, needs, and interests. From touring Broadway shows to dance, comedy, and cirque companies from around the globe, they provide numerous free or reduced-price opportunities for the community to enjoy world-class artists.

Supporting the Next Generation of Performing Arts

Walton Arts Center is home to three resident companies - Symphony of Northwest Arkansas, Trike Theatre for Youth, and Community Creative Center. As an incubator for developing performing arts companies, Walton Arts Center ensures the performing arts remain a vital part of life in our region, responding to the needs of one of the fastest-growing metropolitan areas in the country.

NWA Daily

Mission and History

The Walton Arts Center and Walmart AMP are dedicated to bringing great performing artists and entertainers from around the world to Northwest Arkansas, connecting and engaging people through inspiring arts experiences. Since its inception in the late 1980s, Walton Arts Center has grown significantly and now operates three facilities, enriching the cultural vibrancy of the region, driving the resurgence of Fayetteville's Entertainment District, and fostering emerging artists for over a quarter of a century.

Arts Education & Impact

As a non-profit organization, the revenues from programming at Walton Arts Center and Walmart AMP support learning and education programs that ensure the arts remain an essential part of the lives of students, teachers, and families in Northwest Arkansas. Through various initiatives and partnerships, these institutions work to provide every student in the region access to arts field trips and in-depth professional development for teachers.

Wrap-Up

The Walton Arts Center and Walmart AMP are dedicated to fostering a future where access to great art is a fundamental aspect of the Northwest Arkansas community. Through diverse programming, support for emerging arts companies, and a commitment to arts education, these institutions play a crucial role in shaping the cultural landscape of the region.
node.title: Walton Arts Center & Walmart AMP - A Hub for Arts and Culture in Northwest Arkansas

Nestled in the heart of the Ozarks, Hemmed-In Hollow boasts the tallest waterfall between The Rockies and Appalachians. Standing at an impressive 200-feet, this stunning cascade is a must-see for nature lovers and hiking enthusiasts. With two different trail options, you can choose the path that best suits your needs and abilities. In this blog post, we will guide you through the journey to Hemmed-In Hollow and share some trip highlights and tips for the best experience.

Trail Map and Directions

To reach Hemmed-In Hollow, you can start from either the Compton Trailhead or access the trail from the river during floatable seasons. Both options offer unique experiences and showcase the waterfall's beauty. You can download the Hemmed-In Hollow Trail Map here.

Trailhead Directions from Ponca

To access the Compton Trailhead, drive north on Hwy 43 from Ponca to Compton for about 9 miles, and look for a gravel road on the right marked by a wooden "Wilderness Access" sign. This road is across from a small, vacant store. Turn here, and after about a block, take a hard right. Drive for about a mile until you see another wooden sign marking the right-hand turn to the Hemmed-In Hollow trailhead. At the trailhead, you'll find two trails: one for Hemmed-In Hollow (on the left) and one for Sneeds Creek (on the right), popular among trail riders.

Hemmed-in-Hollow from the River

For a less physically demanding route, consider visiting Hemmed-In Hollow by floating the upper Buffalo River during canoe season (March ‚Äì June). The trail from the river to the waterfall is about 1/2-mile of moderate hiking. The trail starts roughly 1 mile downstream of Jim Bluff (a feature on the river's left side marked by a large, flat rock with the words "Jim Bluff" painted on it). The National Park Service provides a sign marking the pull-out for the trail, but occasional floods may remove the sign, so don't rely on it entirely. The best way to know you're at the right spot is by the number of canoes, kayaks, and rafts already parked at the trailhead.

Trip Highlights

Capture Stunning Photos of the Waterfall: For the best lighting, serious photographers should aim to be at the waterfall by 9:30 AM at the latest. Arriving at 8:30 AM is even better, but it may require starting the trail in the dark during certain times of the year.

Witness the Waterfall in Rain: The optimal time to view the waterfall is during recurring rainfall, like springtime, early summer thunderstorm season, or even fall. In winter, spray from the waterfall can form an ice dome at the base, offering a unique way to appreciate the scenery.

Prepare for a Steady, Steep Hike: This hike is not recommended for young children or those who tire quickly. Although the trail is downhill, it's a steady and sometimes steep 2.5-mile climb out. Make sure to bring plenty of water and snacks.

Explore Sneeds Creek and an Historic Log Cabin: If you're up for a full day of hiking, you can venture down to the Buffalo River from the waterfall in just 20 minutes. This route also leads to the beautiful Sneeds Creek and Granny Henderson's historic log cabin.

Wrap-Up

Hemmed-In Hollow is a breathtaking destination that should be on every nature lover's bucket list. With its awe-inspiring 200-foot waterfall and the stunning surrounding landscape, it's a perfect getaway for hikers and outdoor enthusiasts. Depending on your preferences, you can choose between the Compton Trailhead or the river trail during floatable seasons. Both options offer unique views and an unforgettable experience.

When planning your trip to Hemmed-In Hollow, remember to pack plenty of water, snacks, and sturdy hiking boots to ensure a comfortable and safe journey. The hike can be challenging, especially on the way back up, but the mesmerizing beauty of the waterfall and the surrounding area makes it all worthwhile.

In addition to the main attraction, consider exploring other nearby features, like Sneeds Creek and Granny Henderson's historic log cabin, to fully immerse yourself in the natural beauty of the region. The Hemmed-In Hollow trail is open year-round and offers breathtaking views and experiences no matter the season.

So, gather your hiking gear, download the trail map, and get ready for an unforgettable adventure at Hemmed-In Hollow. With its unmatched beauty and the tallest waterfall between The Rockies and Appalachians, this unique destination is sure to leave you with lasting memories and a deep appreciation for the wonders of nature.
node.title: Hemmed-In Hollow: Exploring the Tallest Waterfall Between The Rockies and Appalachians

Overview of Tanyard Creek Trail

Tanyard Creek Trail is a beautiful 2.2-mile loop trail situated near Bella Vista, Arkansas, offering a perfect day trip for nature lovers and hiking enthusiasts. This easy trail features an elevation gain of 164 ft and an average completion time of 48 minutes. It is a popular destination for bird watching, hiking, and running, so expect to encounter other visitors while exploring this scenic area.

Best Time to Visit and Trail Accessibility

The ideal time to visit Tanyard Creek Trail is from April to November. Dog owners will be pleased to know that their furry friends are welcome, and in some areas, they may even be off-leash. The trail is on private property but is open to the public, and no adverse conditions have been reported in the past seven days.

Activities and Features of Tanyard Creek Trail

Tanyard Creek Trail is kid-friendly and offers a variety of activities, including hiking, walking, bird watching, running, and even exploring a cave. The trail is partially paved and features beautiful views, a waterfall, wildflowers, and a diverse array of flora and fauna. The waterfall, in particular, is a favorite among visitors, as it showcases the natural beauty of this picturesque trail.

Bird Watching and Wildlife

One of the highlights of Tanyard Creek Trail is the opportunity for bird watching. The area is home to numerous species of birds, making it an ideal spot for both amateur and experienced birdwatchers. In addition to birds, you might also spot various fungi and slime molds along the trail.

Trail Maintenance and Difficulty

The trail is well-maintained and has clear signage, making it accessible for hikers of all skill levels. Despite being a relatively easy hike, some sections might have loose rocks, so using trekking poles can be helpful. In addition, some parts of the trail may become muddy during wet conditions, so wearing appropriate footwear is recommended.

Visitor Reviews and Experiences

The Tanyard Creek Trail has received rave reviews from visitors who have enjoyed the scenic waterfall, lush greenery, and well-maintained paths. Many reviewers appreciate the dog-friendly nature of the trail and the opportunity to explore a cave along the route.

Wrap-Up

With easy access from I-49/US71, Tanyard Creek Trail is a must-visit destination for those looking to experience the natural beauty of Bella Vista, Arkansas. So, whether you're a seasoned hiker or just looking for a leisurely stroll in nature, the Tanyard Creek Trail has something for everyone. Grab your hiking boots, pack a picnic, and immerse yourself in the breathtaking views of this remarkable trail.
node.title: Exploring Tanyard Creek Trail: The Perfect Day Trip in Bella Vista, Arkansas
